intro: Heteropholis cochinchinensis var. chenii, commonly known as the Chen's heteropholis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments within tropical forests. Its botanical features include a woody stem and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological traits and limited distribution.
